relevant_findings.general: Pleasant, no apparent distress, alert and oriented times three.
relevant_findings.HEENT: Sclera anicteric. PERRL (5 to 3 bilateral), EOMI. Conjunctiva were pink, dry mucous membranes.
relevant_findings.cardiac: Normal rate, regular rhythm, II/VI systolic murmur at base, no S3 or S4 appreciated. Anterior scar from pacemaker.
relevant_findings.lungs: Mild kyphosis. Respirations unlabored, CTAB, without crackles or wheeze.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, mild tenderness in periumbilical region. No hepatosplenomegaly.
relevant_findings.extremities: No cyanosis, clubbing, or edema. Warm. Evidence of recent trauma to shins.
relevant_findings.skin: No stasis dermatitis, ulcers, scars, or xanthomas.
relevant_findings.neurological: Cranial nerves II-XII grossly intact, strength bilateral upper and lower extremities, sensation grossly intact.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During evaluation, the patient developed a slow ventricular rhythm at 85 BPM with 1:1 retrograde conduction confirmed by atrial electrogram. The patient was asymptomatic during this episode.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Episodes of arrhythmia on pacemaker evaluation; interrogation revealed '3 atrial high-rate episodes', 'EGMs with 1:1 tachycardia at 120 BPM'.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial low blood pressure response (79/60 mmHg) improved after 1L IV fluids, resulted in a noted systolic change.
